intro: Maesa aurulenta, commonly known as golden maesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, glossy leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring. Its root system is fibrous, and it thrives in acidic, well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and seasonal blooms.
